title: Looking for old-books like typefaces, like this ancient frontispiece
content:
I’m looking for these fonts to emulate an old book.  
Do you know some of these typefaces? I just found the Hoefler& Frere-Jones Historical [Fell Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105062601/http:/typography.com/fonts/font_styles.php?itemID=200039&variantTypeID=&cpuCount=&productLineID=100012).

The frontispiece that inspired is attached.

Thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Michael\_Praetorius\_Partitur[1].png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105062601/http:/typophile.com/files/Michael_Praetorius_Partitur%5B1%5D_0.png) | 294.29 KB |

 [‹ (x) Squarish sans caps on New Museum website - Neographic {Florian}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105062601/http:/typophile.com/node/40456 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Catalina" script - Brody (Brophy) {Mike Y} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105062601/http:/typophile.com/node/40455 "Go to next forum topic")
author: buddhapax

comments.content:
Not matches, but antiqued serifs:

[ITC Founder’s Caslon](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105062601/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/itc/itc_founders_caslon/)  
 [Grit Primer](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105062601/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/baseline/grit_primer/)  
 [MVB Celestia](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105062601/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/mvb_fonts/mvb_celestia_antiqua_one/)  
 [ITC Oldbook](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105062601/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/itc_oldbook/)
